Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the influence of the out-of-state pharmaceutical companies by stating that they have raised more campaign dollars than all other state ballot measures combined.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement that the out-of-state pharmaceutical companies have raised more campaign dollars.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the amount of campaign dollars raised is directly related to the influence or impact of the pharmaceutical companies.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the amount of campaign dollars raised, such as the involvement of other interest groups or the importance of the issue at hand.
